title: Can A Four-Day Work Week Solve Victoria’s Teacher Shortage? | 10 News+
description: A controversial new proposal has sparked calls for teachers to trial shortened hours and the ability to work from home while still keeping kids in the classroom for 5 days, claiming it will help address staff shortages. title: Ukraine & Russia Head Into US-Mediated Peace Talks | 10 News
description: Ukraine & Russia are heading into US-mediated peace talks in Switzerland, with land disputes front and centre.   Officials will meet in Geneva to discuss a potential end to the ongoing conflict between the European nations. title: Iran Holds Live-Fire Drills Ahead Of Nuclear Talks With US | 10 News
description: Footage broadcast on Iranian state television shows the military holding live-fire drills in the Strait of Hormuz. title: Trump Calls Cuba A ‘Failed Nation’ As Oil Crisis Worsens | 10 News
description: Donald Trump says Cuba is a “failed nation”, as the country’s oil crisis continues to worsen.  The country has grappled with fuel shortages since the US moved to choke off its oil supplies, blocking exports from Venezuela. title: Iran Live-Fire Drills, New Shadow Cabinet, Ukraine-Russia Peace Talks | 10 News
description: Tonight on 10’s Late News – An out-of-control bushfire has torn through 100 hectares in central Victoria, a stabbing attack in Western Sydney has left one person dead and two others fighting for life, NSW Police continue to appeal for the safe release of a kidnapped 85-year-old man, Opposition Leader Angus Taylor has announced his new shadow cabinet, Ukraine and Russia head into peace talks in Switzerland, Iran is undertaking live-fire drills in the Strait of Hormuz, and US civil rights leader Jesse Jackson has died at the age of 84. title: Gunfire Erupts At Protest Memorial | 10 News
description: Eyewitness video filmed on Tuesday shows protesters chanting “Death to Khamenei” at a cemetery in Abdanan, in Iran’s Ilam province.  Moments later, a loud boom rings out and crowds scatter in panic, with witnesses saying the sound was gunfire.  The gathering marked 40 days since protesters were killed during a nationwide crackdown by authorities.  Security forces have moved to suppress memorial events in several cities, amid ongoing unrest over the government’s handling of the demonstrations. title: Decade-Long Ticket Scam Exposed At The Louvre In Paris | 10 News
description: It’s been a tough few months for one of the most famous museums in the world.  The Louvre is now facing yet another scandal, after it was revealed it was the target of a wide-ranging ticket scam network, costing the Parisian icon millions of dollars.  10’s Late News explains. title: Five Injured In New York Church Explosion After Suspected Gas Leak | 10 News
description: A pastor and four firefighters have been injured after an explosion ripped through a church in upstate New York on Tuesday.  Fire crews were dispatched to the Abundant Life Fellowship church in Boonville following reports of a gas leak just before 10:30am.  It’s understood three firefighters and pastor Brandon Pitts were in the basement of the church when the furnace triggered a massive gas explosion that destroyed the building.  An investigation into the blast is underway but police said that “there is no indication of criminal activity at this time.”  Join the conversation and follow us on: Twitter: http://twitter.com/10NewsAU Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/10NewsAU/ Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/10NewsAU/ TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@10NewsAU  10 News airs at 5 pm, seven nights a week in your local market on Network 10. title: Tributes Pour In After Civil Rights Leader Jesse Jackson Dies At 84 | 10 News
description: US civil rights leader Reverend Jesse Jackson has died aged 84, prompting tributes across the country.   A close associate of Martin Luther King Jr and founder of the Rainbow PUSH Coalition, Jackson twice sought the Democratic presidential nomination and remained active in public life for decades.  Reverend Al Sharpton called him a transformational figure who “changed American politics,” while mourners gathered in Chicago and at Atlanta’s Ebenezer Baptist Church to honour his legacy.  The United Nations hailed Jackson as a global champion of human rights, saying his advocacy against racism and inequality inspired generations worldwide. title: Man Charged With Murder After Fatal Sydney Stabbing At Grocery Store | 10 News
description: A man has been charged with murder following a horrific triple stabbing in Sydney’s west yesterday.  A 22-year-old man was killed and two others critically injured in what police describe as a random attack at a Merrylands grocery store - all captured on CCTV.  New South Wales Health has confirmed the alleged attacker absconded from care and had been missing for 10 days.  Sarah Navin has the latest. title: New Details Revealed From Infamous Ex-Prince Andrew Interview
description: “Must've made all that up on the spot.”  The journalist behind the infamous BBC interview, which saw Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's fall from grace as he tried and failed to defend his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein, has revealed bizarre new details and lies.
